Articles.Content:
Hello everyone!

I registered here a few weeks ago after playing the free demo for a few months

and just now stumbled upon the introduction section, so I hope I don\'t upset any

moderators or admins by starting this thread. :-[

Well now some informations about myself:

I am German, so German is my main language so I hope you understand if I write silly sometimes.

I found out about Kerbal Space Program at the gmod.de forum a few months ago and immediately loved it.

My favorite kind of games are space and flight oriented games like: Homeworld, Freespace, Freelancer,

StarLancer,X2, Garrysmod, Crysis (mainly the Cry Engine Sandbox and the VTOL), IL2, Lock On and of course Kerbal Space Program,

because I love to mod games.

I have already begun to port some of my ships to Kerbal Space Program, but since I have to split them up into proper parts it takes a while.

But I have managed to create a proof of concept ship with a bad texture for KSP:

I know, the texture is horrible but it wasn\'t meant for release anyway.

I also tried RP\'ing a while ago but due to my lack of time I had to give it up.

(And because I spend hours editing my posts to make sure that I don\'t write too much garbage )

I guess thats all I have to say :-X.

Edit:

It seems that the Forum doesn\'t like dropbox links...

It should be fixed now.

Homeworld? Same here, it\'s a really great game.

And you\'re always welcome to the RP anytime if that\'s what you meant.

Anyways, welcome to the forums!

Hi Matzenino, welcome to the forums.

You have good taste in games, have you had a chance to try Starwolves as well? It has some similarities to Homeworld.

Also if you can find a copy, Tie Fighter is not to be missed, or one of my favorites, Space rangers 2, though it\'s not a traditional space flight game it\'s still a lot of fun.

Have fun flying

Oh yes Starwolves...

I played the demo of it and kinda liked it.

Sadly the retail price at the time was a little too big for me to afford.

But from what I remember of it, it felt like Nexus the Jupiter Incident.

Also a great game btw!

How could I forget Nexus after all the hassle I had with an illegible product key It\'s a brilliant game, jeeze I could play space games forever, just the other day I dug out my copy of Independence War and I still play Frontier and First Encounters.

I wish space combat would come back into fashion, no ones tried making a modern newtonian space combat game complete with orbits, I\'ve always wondered how it\'d turn out.

Maybe if KSP gets multiplayer, there\'s already a few gun mods

Welcome to the KSP Forums!

Happy Launching!

Arrr!

Capt\'n Skunky

KSP Community Manager
